result.execSummary:
The defendant Russel Joseph Magnuson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Sentence w/held probation 2 years - Absolute Sobriety - Any counseling DOC may impose - costs $443.00

miscConds.notes: Costs $243.00   Pay obligation within 30 days or apply to the Clerk of Court for a payment plan within 30 days and pay the $15.00 payment plan fee.
Absolute Sobriety - Any counseling DOC may impose

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Russel Joseph Magnuson in court with attorney Thomas W Duffy.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Also has 16 CF 59 and 16 CF 63.   State recites agreement 15 CF 272: plea NC to count 2 OWI 4th - $2122.00 - 230 days jail credit 30 days time served stayed to complete on electronic monitor  - 27 mo. revocation - AODA with VIP and 27 MO. IID - balance of counts are to be DRI
16 CF 59 and and 16 CF 63  State moved to amend to Misd. Bail Jumping - Sentence w/held probation 2 years - absolute sobriety and counseling and costs.  State grants motion to amend 15 CF 59 and 15 CF 63 to misd. Bail Jumping.  DE entered Plea of NC to 16 CF 272, 16 CF 59 and 16 CF 63.    DE advised of rights and penalties; DE waives rights; parties stipulate to facts.  Court advised the DE as to the relationship between his attorney and himself.  DE wishes to continue/State wishes to continue.  Court finds defendant guilty.



16 CF 59 as amended:  Sentence w/held probation 2 years - Absolute sobriety - any counseling DOC may impose - costs $443.00

16 CF 63 as amended:  Sentence w/held probation 2 years - Absolute sobriety - any counseling DOC may impose - costs $443.00
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 18, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Russel Joseph Magnuson in court with attorney Thomas W Duffy.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court cancels warrant.    Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint,    Defense/DE waives time limits for preliminary hearing.   Court reinstates cash bond in 15CF272  and Court sets new bond:  $15,000 signature plus $1500 cash- COMBINED cases: 15CF272, 16CF63, 16CF59.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 2, 2016 at 11:00 am.

$15,000 signature plus $1500 cash component- COMBINED cases: 15CF272, 16CF63, 16CF59. 
$1500 cash already posted.
Standard STOP Program Conditions:
Defendant shall not possess any dangerous weapons.
Defendant shall not consume alcoholic beverages or illegal drugs.
Defendant shall not drive without a valid drivers license.
Defendant is ordered to report to Health and Human Services at 10610 Main Street, Hayward, WI within 48 hours (excluding weekends and holidays) upon release from custody to schedule an intake with a STOP case manager (715-638-3317)for the purpose of  learning about the Court's intoxicated driver intervention program.  Failure to appear may result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, a bond modification hearing, possible bail jumping charges and / or forfeiture of any bond deposit.
*****Required to Random testing  through the STOP Program*****
